pr_title: Fix a few issues with go examples generation

timeline.message:
Fix a few issues with go examples generation

This fixes a bunch of issues seen when generating go examples, namely
 - Numbers aren't casted to the right type
 - The time import is missing
 - Enums are treated as regular models
Handle multiple instances in the same doc
Removes links to basic types in arrays
Remove links to basic types in maps

timeline.bodyText: I'd suggest using "map[string][]".length() instead of 13. It's self-commenting and also prevents off-by-one errors. (There are couple instances of this, so please fix them all)
timeline.author: bkabrda

replies.bodyText: Good thinking. I tried removeStart  which seems even more clear, let me know if it works.
replies.author: therve

timeline.bodyText: @therve FYI. I've fled #7998 to fix the string comparison in this line and a few other lines in this file.
timeline.author: wing328

replies.bodyText: Sorry about. Not sure why I didn't catch that during testing :/
replies.author: therve

replies.bodyText: No worries. No one complains. We spotted it with a code analyser.
replies.author: wing328
